channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- Newsletter Popup
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- Newsletter Popup

item.title: CVE-2024-3642|2024-05-16T06:00:02.572Z -- Unknown -- Newsletter Popup
item.description: The Newsletter Popup WordPress plugin through 1.2 does not have CSRF check when deleting subscriber, which could allow attackers to make logged in admins perform such action via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-3643|2024-05-16T06:00:02.799Z -- Unknown -- Newsletter Popup
item.description: The Newsletter Popup WordPress plugin through 1.2 does not have CSRF check when deleting list, which could allow attackers to make logged in admins perform such action via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-3644|2024-05-16T06:00:03.032Z -- Unknown -- Newsletter Popup
item.description: The Newsletter Popup WordPress plugin through 1.2 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)

item.title: CVE-2024-3641|2024-05-16T06:00:01.973Z -- Unknown -- Newsletter Popup
item.description: The Newsletter Popup WordPress plugin through 1.2 does not sanitise and escape some parameters, which could allow unauthenticated visitors to perform Cross-Site Scripting attacks against admins
